questions.question: I …………………. to quit my job a few days ago.
questions.description: We cannot use the present perfect tense with time expressions referring to the past.

questions.question: The ……………….. were on time.
questions.description: Others mean the same as other people.

questions.question: I did it ………………….. to offend him.
questions.description: The correct expression is ‘so as to’. In negative expressions we use ‘so as not to’.

questions.question: Jane, …………… is on holiday at the moment, is my colleague.
questions.description: In non-identifying relative clauses, we cannot use that.

questions.question: We ……………….. the station at 3 o’clock.
questions.description: When reach means 'arrive at', it does not require a preposition before the object.

questions.question: As someone born in the eighties, I like that kind of ………………
questions.description: Music is uncountable. We cannot use the article ‘a’ with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: I had a great day at the races ………………. I won.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. We use it before a clause. Because of is a preposition. We use it before a noun. Due to is also a preposition.

questions.question: I visited them …………………
questions.description: We do not normally use prepositions before common expressions like yesterday, last week, last year etc.

questions.question: I did it because he ……………… me to do it.
questions.description: 'Ask for' means ask somebody to give something

questions.question: I don’t know …………….. she will come or not.
questions.description: Whether is preferred in a two-part question with or.
